image.altText: An unidentified woman stands in front of the Wheel of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: What started as after-work drinks on a Friday evening quickly turned into a nightmare when Jessica* arrived at a popular bar in central Brisbane.

title.children: 'I was completely paralytic': Jessica doesn't know what her drink was spiked with — and that's part of the problem

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair looks off to the side standing in front of a pink cosmetics display.

props.synopsis: Australian cosmetics company MCoBeauty has become a multi-million-dollar business by "duping" popular beauty products. But its success hasn't been without controversy, after pushing the boundaries of the law too far in the past.

title.children: How Australia's fastest-growing beauty brand gets away with copying cosmetics

image.altText: First responders arrive at the scene of a Greyhound bus collision on Bruce Highway.

props.synopsis: Grey nomads, backpackers, and locals question the safety of roads in regional Australia after a devastating crash involving a bus and a car towing a caravan in North Queensland at the weekend.

title.children: Weekend Greyhound bus fatality 'just brought it all back' for community 'still reeling'

image.altText: Donald Trump looks stern with US flag behind him.

props.synopsis: America's highest court finds ex-presidents have significant protection from criminal prosecution — a historic ruling that could have major ramifications for the charges against Donald Trump.

title.children: 'A king above the law': US Supreme Court's Trump ruling prompts judges to warn of 'nightmare scenarios'

image.altText: Assange and Robinson sit in plane seats, looking happy.

props.synopsis: For the first time, two of the people closest to the negotiations to free Julian Assange have revealed what it took to convince the United States to release the man who had published hundreds of thousands of their most secret documents.

title.children: As Julian Assange languished in a British prison, Anthony Albanese passed a message to his lawyers that would prove a turning point

image.altText: Assange and Robinson sit in plane seats, looking happy.

props.synopsis: For the first time, two of the people closest to the negotiations to free Julian Assange have revealed what it took to convince the United States to release the man who had published hundreds of thousands of their most secret documents.

title.children: As Julian Assange languished in a British prison, Anthony Albanese passed a message to his lawyers that would prove a turning point

image.altText: Side photo of Queensland police car.

props.synopsis: Detectives say there may be more alleged victims, and are urging people with information to come forward, after more than a year of investigating the alleged historic crimes.

title.children: Two elderly men charged with multiple child sex offences dating back to 1970s in North Queensland

image.altText: The silhouette of a soldier holding a large gun in the window of a home.

props.synopsis: As the war in Ukraine drags into its third year, some Russian soldiers have decided to flee the front lines. This is how they did it.

title.children: 'I ran away, and now they're all dead': The Russian soldiers who escaped the front lines

image.altText: colours and numbers light up a gaming machine

props.synopsis: The state opposition will take the policy to the looming Queensland election, arguing an increase to the cap will throw a "lifeline" to smaller clubs facing closure.

title.children: Queensland LNP promises to increase pokies cap for clubs with more than two premises

image.altText: Young smiling woman with long dark hair pulled back, holding a baby, whose face is blurred.

props.synopsis: Formerly married couple Robert Samuel Geeves and Anne Margaret Geeves were the last people to see Amber Haigh alive. Twenty-two years after her disappearance, they are facing trial for her alleged murder.

title.children: Amber Haigh's alleged killer kept her bank card away from her, court hears

image.altText: Woman sitting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: Non-fatal strangulation, or choking during sex, is becoming mainstream among young people in Australia — fuelled by pornography and popular culture. It's prompted concerns that those engaging in the practice are not aware of the serious health risks.

title.children: Choking during sex can cause brain injuries but many young Australians are taking up the act

image.altText: An out of focus man and woman walk past a building with glass sliding doors and a sign reading Reserve Bank of Australia.

props.synopsis: Australia's much-discussed narrow path out of the inflation fight is rapidly turning into a highwire act. While one more rate hike from the RBA could cause a recession, holding back if inflation accelerates further will damage its credibility.

title.children: We're richer than everyone else. But one more rate hike could change that

image.altText: A picture of cow manure with a sign saying 'ALP climate policy' in it

props.synopsis: Activists target the office of federal Labor backbencher Peter Khalil in the North Melbourne suburb of Coburg to protest the party's climate inaction. Follow live.

title.children: Cow manure dumped outside Labor backbencher's office to protest 'bull****' climate policy

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lambie cries 'hallelujah' as she says Labor has finally seen the light
Activists dump cow manure in front of Labor MP's office
Labor caucus endorses decision to suspend Payman

image.altText: Police officers stand behind police tape at the scene of a stabbing

props.synopsis: Paramedics were called to the grounds of the university in Camperdown, where a man was found with a single stab wound.

title.children: 14yo boy arrested after man stabbed on grounds of University of Sydney

image.altText: Barry Foreman smiles in front of a Fedex warehouse

props.synopsis: More people are retiring later in life. Here's how these Australians stay happy and engaged at work.

title.children: This 77yo is thriving alongside his Gen Z colleagues. Here's his secret to career longevity

image.altText: sir ian

props.synopsis: Sir Ian McKellen has withdrawn from his UK tour of Player Kings after he fell off the stage mid-performance at a London theatre last month.

title.children: Ian McKellen won't return to theatre role after fall from stage

image.altText: Singer John Farnham sitting at a restaurant with his wife, son, and son's wife melissa at the table with him

props.synopsis: The iconic Australian singer is honoured by family members as he marks the milestone.

title.children: John Farnham pictured celebrating his 75th birthday with wife and son

image.altText: A family walking backwards.

props.synopsis: It's the first time in more than 50 years that an infectious disease is among the five leading causes of death in Australia.

title.children: Life expectancy in Australia has fallen for the first time in about 30 years

image.altText: Man talks into microphone, banners behind read 'free bannon'

props.synopsis: Long-time Donald Trump ally Steve Bannon has been taken into custody after surrendering at a federal prison to begin a sentence on contempt charges for defying a subpoena in the congressional investigation into the US Capitol attack.

title.children: 'I'm proud to go to prison': Trump ally Bannon surrenders to serve 4-month sentence for contempt of Congress

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab head scarf and glasses

props.synopsis: Senator Fatima Payman's "exile" from Labor's caucus sparks fresh speculation about a backlash towards the Labor Party from parts of Australia's Muslim community.

title.children: Fatima Payman weighs up future within Labor, as party faces Muslim community backlash

image.altText: A stick with a burnt end surrounded by rocks

props.synopsis: Remnants of fireplaces and burnt, fat-smeared sticks excavated in a secluded cave in Victoria point to an ancient ritual where a powerful Gunaikurnai doctor, known as a mulla-mullung, cast a spell.

title.children: In a Gippsland cave, remains of an ancient Aboriginal ritual lay hidden for 12,000 years

image.altText: A Black African cyclist stands smiling with fist pumped at the end of a stage in the Tour de France.

props.synopsis: Biniam Girmay earns a historic win in stage three of the Tour de France — and his team says it hopes it "opens the floodgates" for more riders from Africa to make it in the sport of road cycling.

title.children: 'This is for all Africans': Tour de France history as Biniam Girmay becomes first black rider to win stage

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka pictured at Wimbledon in 2023

props.synopsis: A shock withdrawal by a "heartbroken" Aryna Sabalenka throws the women's draw into chaos as Naomi Osaka wins her first match at the All England Club in six years, while Casper Ruud gives a chilling insight into his battle with parasites.

title.children: Five quick hits — 'Heartbroken' Sabalenka injury causes Wimbledon chaos, Osaka ends major drought and a star's battle with parasites revealed

image.altText: Cristiano Ronaldo is consoled by Diogo Dalot

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo's tears turn to triumph as Portugal's goalkeeper turns in an all-time penalty shootout performance, while Belgium's golden generation's heartache continues after losing to France and an England star is under investigation.

title.children: Five quick hits — Ronaldo's tears turn to triumph as keeper's penalty heroics save Portugal, England star under investigation over celebration

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market falls in morning trade, despite a strong performance from tech stocks Apple, Tesla and Microsoft, which drove Wall Street higher. Follow live.

title.children: ASX slips ahead of Reserve Bank minutes, tech stocks drive Wall Street higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bonza liquidation provides "bittersweet news" for airline's staff
ANZ sanctioned for breaches of the Banking Code of Practice
Coal, oil and gas are best performing stocks on the ASX

image.altText: A man bing led by police into court.

props.synopsis: Melbourne man Christopher Bell, 53, has been sentenced to seven years' jail after killing George Tereva in a bobcat accident in 2022. Bell had consumed five beers when he took control of the vehicle.

title.children: Victorian man who fatally hit colleague while 'playing chicken' with bobcat jailed

image.altText: People letting off fireworks on a beach

props.synopsis: Emergency services say there have been several injuries, including facial burns to a six-month-old and burns to the groin region of a 37-year-old man, during the annual night when people can legally let off fireworks in the Northern Territory.

title.children: NT's fireworks night sees multiple injuries and community shed burnt down

image.altText: The sun rises over a mist-covered field as a flock of geese feed.

props.synopsis: Adelaide shivers through its coldest morning in years according to the BOM, with temperatures dropping below zero degrees Celsius in some parts of the city overnight.

title.children: Adelaide records coldest morning in years with homelessness services on standby

image.altText: A hurrican storm is in white clouds forming on world map

props.synopsis: A powerful Hurricane Beryl has made landfall on an island in the Caribbean after becoming a "life-threatening" category 4 storm, fuelled by record warm waters.

title.children: 'Life-threatening' Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in Caribbean

image.altText: A bowl of porridge topped with banana and brown sugar sitting on a wooden table

props.synopsis: A warm bowl of porridge is many people's go-to winter breakfast but it can leave us hungry. Here are tips from nutritionists to make porridge more filling.

title.children: Still hungry after porridge? Nutritionists share their tricks to make it more filling

image.altText: a pair of legs wrapped in bandages

props.synopsis: A tourist mauled by a pack of dogs in the remote Northern Territory is calling for greater controls after discovering it's unclear which level of government has responsibility for managing dangerous animals.

title.children: Tourist mauled by seven dogs in remote NT calls for greater controls

image.altText: Two men stand behind a video camera next to a highway. It's dusk and a mountain range is lit up in the background

props.synopsis: From filming in some of the most remote and inhospitable areas of Australia, to working with an A-list Hollywood actor, this is how the ABC Science team investigated what killed our ancient megafauna.

title.children: How we made two hours of TV about an ancient true crime mystery
